text: The grand prix de la Critique littéraire was created in 1948 by Robert André. It is awarded each year by the French PEN club to a literary essay. Chaired by , its jury is now made up of Jean Blot, Jean-Luc Despax, Jean-Claude Lamy, Daniel Leuwers, , Laurence Paton (general secretary), and . Since its creation, it has rewarded many leading authors and intends to promote a literary criticism of quality and, quite simply, literature. == List of laureates == * 2015: Pierre Boncenne, for Le Parapluie de Simon Ley, Philippe Rey * 2014: Paul Audi, for Qui témoignera pour nous ?
